017package org.apache.juneau.bean.jsonschema;
018
019/**
020 * Represents possible JSON types in the JSON-Schema core specification.
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * Implements custom <c>toString()</c> and <c>fromString(String)</c> methods that override the default
024 * serialization/parsing behavior of <c>Enum</c> types so that they are represented in lowercase form (as per the
025 * specification).
026 *
027 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
028 * <p class='bjava'>
029 *    <jc>// Produces 'number', not 'NUMBER'.</jc>
030 *    String <jv>json</jv> = Json.<jsm>from</jsm>(JsonType.<jsf>NUMBER</jsf>);
031 * </p>
032 */
033public enum JsonType {
034
035   /** JSON type {@code array}. */
036   ARRAY("array"),
037
038   /** JSON type {@code boolean}. */
039   BOOLEAN("boolean"),
040
041   /** JSON type {@code integer}. */
042   INTEGER("integer"),
043
044   /** JSON type {@code null}. */
045   NULL("null"),
046
047   /** JSON type {@code number}. */
048   NUMBER("number"),
049
050   /** JSON type {@code object}. */
051   OBJECT("object"),
052
053   /** JSON type {@code string}. */
054   STRING("string"),
055
056   /** JSON type {@code any}. */
057   ANY("any");
058
059   private final String value;   // The serialized format of the enum.
060
061   JsonType(String value) {
062      this.value = value;
063   }
064
065   /**
066    * Returns the lowercase form of this enum that's compatible with the JSON-Schema specification.
067    */
068   @Override /* Object */
069   public String toString() {
070      return value;
071   }
072
073   /**
074    * Converts the specified lowercase form of the enum back into an <c>Enum</c>.
075    *
076    * @param value The lowercase form of the enum (e.g. <js>"array"</js>).
077    * @return The matching <c>Enum</c>, or <jk>null</jk> if no match found.
078    */
079   public static JsonType fromString(String value) {
080      if (value == null || value.length() < 4)
081         return null;
082      var c = value.charAt(0);
083      if (c == 'a') {
084         if (value.equals("array"))
085            return ARRAY;
086         if (value.equals("any"))
087            return ANY;
088      }
089      if (c == 'b' && value.equals("boolean"))
090         return BOOLEAN;
091      if (c == 'i' && value.equals("integer"))
092         return INTEGER;
093      if (c == 'n') {
094         c = value.charAt(2);
095         if (c == 'l' && value.equals("null"))
096            return NULL;
097         if (c == 'm' && value.equals("number"))
098            return NUMBER;
099         return null;
100      }
101      if (c == 'o' && value.equals("object"))
102         return OBJECT;
103      if (c == 's' && value.equals("string"))
104         return STRING;
105      return null;
106   }
107}
